Package org.framework.rodolfo.freire.git.bank.authorize.controller

Class AccountController

java.lang.Object
org.framework.rodolfo.freire.git.bank.authorize.controller.AccountController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/accounts") public class AccountController extends Object
Controller for managing Account entities. Provides RESTful endpoints for CRUD operations, as well as handling deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and balance movements. Uses AccountService for interaction with the data layer.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Account>> getAll()
      Retrieves all Account entities.
      Returns:
      A list of all accounts.

    • getById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Account> getById(@PathVariable Long id)
      Retrieves an Account by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The account entity if found, otherwise a 404 status.

    • save

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Account> save(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid Account account)
      Creates a new Account.
      Parameters:
      account - The account data to create.
      Returns:
      The created account with status 201.

    • update

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Account> update(@PathVariable Long id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid Account account)
      Updates an existing Account specified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account to update.
      account - The account data with updates.
      Returns:
      The updated account.

    • delete

      @DeleteMapping("/{accountId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> delete(@PathVariable Long accountId)
      Deletes an Account specified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      accountId - The ID of the account to delete.
      Returns:
      A response indicating the deletion status.

    • deposit

      @PostMapping("/{accountId}/deposit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deposit(@PathVariable Long accountId, @RequestParam Double amount, @RequestParam AccountType type)
      Deposits a specified amount into the account.
      Parameters:
      accountId - The ID of the account where the deposit will be made.
      amount - The amount to be deposited.
      type - The type of account (e.g., FOOD, MEAL, CASH).
      Returns:
      A response indicating whether the deposit was successful.

    • withdraw

      @PostMapping("/{id}/withdraw") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> withdraw(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestParam Double amount, @RequestParam AccountType type)
      Withdraws a specified amount from the account.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account from which the withdrawal will be made.
      amount - The amount to be withdrawn.
      type - The type of account (e.g., FOOD, MEAL, CASH).
      Returns:
      A response indicating whether the withdrawal was successful.

    • transfer

      @PostMapping("/transfer") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> transfer(@RequestParam Long fromAccountId, @RequestParam Long toAccountId, @RequestParam Double amount, @RequestParam AccountType type)
      Transfers a specified amount between two accounts.
      Parameters:
      fromAccountId - The ID of the source account.
      toAccountId - The ID of the target account.
      amount - The amount to be transferred.
      type - The type of account (e.g., FOOD, MEAL, CASH).
      Returns:
      A response indicating whether the transfer was successful.

    • moveBalance

      @PostMapping("/{id}/moveBalance") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> moveBalance(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestParam Double amount, @RequestParam AccountType fromType, @RequestParam AccountType toType)
      Moves balance between different types within the same account.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account.
      amount - The amount to be moved.
      fromType - The source account type.
      toType - The target account type.
      Returns:
      A response indicating whether the balance move was successful.

    • hasSufficientBalance

      @GetMapping("/{id}/has-sufficient-balance") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Boolean> hasSufficientBalance(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestParam Double amount, @RequestParam AccountType type)
      Checks if there is sufficient balance in the specified account type. If not, it checks the CASH balance.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account.
      amount - The amount to check.
      type - The type of account to check.
      Returns:
      true if there is sufficient balance; false otherwise.
